content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]Tempulli has submitted a project proposal for a grant from the European Commission seeking technical and financial support. This ambitious project proposal enables the purchase of technological and other technical equipment to upgrade the infrastructure for the needs of students and other citizens who may be consumers of Tempulli services. The project proposal holds the EuropeAid/165883/DD/ACT/XK Reference.

 “ROAD SAFETY” NATIONAL PROJECT

Taking into consideration the state of road safety in our country and the great need for conducting activities that affect the awareness-raising of all traffic participants, AMRKS and Tempulli in cooperation with the Ministry of Infrastructure, Ministry of Education, Science and Technology, Ministry of Internal Affairs, Kosovo Police and Kosovar Forum for Road Safety (KFRS) have been carrying out various activities within the “Road Safety” national project for many years.

The “Road Safety” national project primarily aims to raise awareness and culture for safe traffic behavior for all road users.

These activities have educational content. Tempulli believes that with our work we are able to contribute to a large part of the society, especially with children and young people. However, in order to achieve maximum results in the common cause we need time and effort from all of us, by properly guiding all age groups from pre-primary institutions to university.

“DON’T TAKE IT THIS FAR” NATIONAL PROJECT

It is a public call to all traffic participants to respect traffic signs. As part of this campaign, a total of six television video spots have been produced, each of which demonstrates the consequences of disregarding traffic rules and behavior, with particular emphasis on: seat belts, driving under the influence of alcohol, seat for children, speeding, using the phone while driving, and not keeping a distance while driving.

“BE CAREFUL FROM SLIDING” NATIONAL PROJECT

It is intended to sensitize drivers and citizens to carry winter equipment during the winter season in order to avoid road traffic accidents. The brochures were produced in Albanian, English and Serbian and have been distributed to the citizens by the Kosovo Police.

#SAVEKIDSLIVES INTERNATIONAL PROJECT

Kosovo has become part of the #Save Kids Lives international road child safety campaign. Citizens of Kosovo have shown their support for this campaign by signing the Declaration of Children, which is a call from children from all over the world to reach out to adults and institutions to do more to enable them free movement on the road.

UNITED NATIONS FOURTH WEEK OF GLOBAL ROAD SAFETY (SaveLives #SlowDown) INTERNATIONAL PROJECT

In Kosovo it was jointly organized by all institutions in the country that have mandate and deal with traffic safety issues.

Activity agenda included: press conference, lecture on road safety at Pristina Mental Health Center and NGO SOS Willage, distribution of coloring books “How to Move Safe on the Road” at Pediatric Hospital, conducting surveys in different regions with drivers of motorized vehicles, in order to assess their knowledge of motor vehicle components, etc.

”ROAD SAFETY” WEEKLY PROGRAM  

In cooperation with KTV and Tempulli realized about 200 weekly “Road Safety” TV programs. These TV shows have provided viewers with information on developments and current happening in transport and traffic in the country.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][stm_wp_custommenu nav_menu=”100″ width=”100%”][/vc_column][/vc_row]
